{"step_by_step_thinking": "Based on the patient's desire for elective termination of pregnancy, the most appropriate procedure would be a method that is safe, effective, and can be performed early in pregnancy. Options A, B, and C (Dilatation and evacuation, Oxytocin-induced labor, and Manual uterine aspiration) are typically used for later gestational ages and may not be suitable for this patient. Option D (Oral mifepristone + misoprostol) is a commonly used method for early elective termination of pregnancy. It is safe, effective, and can be performed in an outpatient setting. Therefore, the most appropriate choice for this patient is D. Oral mifepristone + misoprostol.", "answer_choice": "D"}
